game.engine.animation

Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.animation.Quaternion

  • public class Quaternion
extends java.lang.Object
    A quaternion simply represents a 3D rotation. The maths behind it is quite complex (literally; it involves complex numbers) so I wont go into it in too much detail. The important things to note are that it represents a 3d rotation, it's very easy to interpolate between two quaternion rotations (which would not be easy to do correctly with Euler rotations or rotation matrices), and you can convert to and from matrices fairly easily. So when we need to interpolate between rotations we'll represent them as quaternions, but when we need to apply the rotations to anything we'll convert back to a matrix.
    Author:
    Karl

      Quaternion(float x, float y, float z, float w)
      Creates a quaternion and normalizes it.
      Quaternion(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f matrix)
      Extracts the rotation part of a transformation matrix and converts it to a quaternion using the magic of maths.

      • Quaternion

        public Quaternion(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f matrix)
        Extracts the rotation part of a transformation matrix and converts it to a quaternion using the magic of maths.
        Parameters:
        matrix - - the transformation matrix containing the rotation which this quaternion shall represent.

    • Method Detail

      • toRotationMatrix

        public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f toRotationMatrix()
        Converts the quaternion to a 4x4 matrix representing the exact same rotation as this quaternion. (The rotation is only contained in the top-left 3x3 part, but a 4x4 matrix is returned here for convenience seeing as it will be multiplied with other 4x4 matrices).
        Returns:
        The rotation matrix which represents the exact same rotation as this quaternion.

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Normalizes the quaternion.

      • slerp

        public static Quaternion slerp(Quaternion start,
                               Quaternion end,
                               float progression)
        Interpolates between two quaternion rotations and returns a new quaternion which represents a rotation somewhere in between the two input rotations.
        Parameters:
        start - - the starting rotation.
        end - - the end rotation.
        progression - - a value between 0 and 1 indicating how much to interpolate between the two rotations. 0 would retrun the start rotation, and 1 would return the end rotation.
        Returns:
        The interpolated rotation as a quaternion.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
